creator: UCEKAGENMULL@spammotel.com
text:
I want add a directory in an archive with chmod="777" but chmod is ignored when 
I add a directory to the archive. 

<tarfileset dir="${build.web.dir}" username="${username}" group="devel" 
mode="777">
  <include name="evu/tiff"/>
</tarfileset>
drwxr-xr-x fjb/devel         0 2002-08-29 14:55:49 evu/tiff/

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text:
Could you please show us the complete <tar> task you are using?

Maybe you are adding the same directory via a different fileset as well.

creator: UCEKAGENMULL@spammotel.com
text:
The part in comment should add the directory with the mode 777 but it
doesn't work.



<tar tarfile="${dist.dir}/EVU-WEB-${version}.tar" longfile="gnu">
  <tarfileset dir="${build.web.dir}" username="${username}" group="devel">
    <include name="*/**"/>
    <exclude name="evu/tiff"/>
  </tarfileset>
  <tarfileset dir="${build.web.dir}" username="${username}" group="devel" 
mode="777">
    <include name="evu/tiff"/>
  </tarfileset>
</tar>

creator: bodewig@apache.org

text: <tarfileset> has an additional dirmode attribute now.
